tags.name: Test  Plans
tags.description: Work with test plans programmatically using the REST APIs for Azure DevOps Services and Azure DevOps Server.

tags.name: Test  Suite  Entry
tags.description: Reorder test suite entries (test cases and child test suites) in a given test suite.

tags.name: Test  Suites
tags.description: Test suites help in organizing test cases in a test plan. A test suite can contain child test suites, helping you build a folder structure under a test plan or it can contain test cases. Leaf test suites typically contain test cases, where are intermediate suites represent a folder hierarchy. Intermediate suites can on Static type, whereas leaf suites can be of static suites, requirement based suites or query based suites.

tags.name: Test Cases
tags.description: Controller to handle WIT scoped TestCase APIs

get.description: Find the list of all test suites in which a given test case is present. This is helpful if you need to find out which test suites are using a test case, when you need to make changes to a test case.
get.operationId: Get Suites By Test Case Id

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: testCaseId
parameters.description: ID of the test case for which suites need to be fetched.

get.description: Get a list of test configurations.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: If the list of configurations returned is not complete, a continuation token to query next batch of configurations is included in the response header as "x-ms-continuationtoken". Omit this parameter to get the first batch of test configurations.

_links.description: This field contains zero or more interesting links about the graph subject. These links may be invoked to obtain additional relationships or more detailed information about this graph subject.

descriptor.description: The descriptor is the primary way to reference the graph subject while the system is running. This field will uniquely identify the same graph subject across both Accounts and Organizations.

displayName.description: This is the non-unique display name of the graph subject. To change this field, you must alter its value in the source provider.

url.description: This url is the full route to the source resource of this graph subject.

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

definitionId.description: ID of the release definition that contains the release environment definition.

environmentDefinitionId.description: ID of the release environment definition.

SuiteEntry.description: A suite entry defines properties for a test suite.

SuiteEntryUpdateParams.description: A suite entry defines properties for a test suite.

id.description: Id of the suite entry in the test suite: either a test case id or child suite id.

sequenceNumber.description: Sequence number for the suite entry object in the test suite.

suiteEntryType.description: Defines whther the entry is of type test case or suite.

TeamProjectReference.description: Represents a shallow reference to a TeamProject.

values.description: Project is in the process of being deleted.
Project is in the process of being created.
Project is completely created and ready to use.
Project has been queued for creation, but the process has not yet started.

url.description: Url to the full version of the object.

project.description: Id of the test configuration variable

TestConfigurationCreateUpdateParameters.description: Test Configuration Create or Update Parameters

isDefault.description: Is the configuration a default for the test plans

values.description: The configuration can be used for new test runs.
The configuration has been retired and should not be used for new test runs.
Dictionary of Test Variable, Selected Value

syncOutcomeAcrossSuites.description: Value to configure how test outcomes for the same tests across suites are shown

project.description: Project which contains the test plan.

rootSuite.description: Root test suite of the test plan.

buildDefinition.description: The Build Definition that generates a build associated with this test plan.

endDate.description: End date for the test plan.

iteration.description: Iteration path of the test plan.

releaseEnvironmentDefinition.description: Release Environment to be used to deploy the build and run automated tests from this test plan.

startDate.description: Start date for the test plan.

testOutcomeSettings.description: Value to configure how same tests across test suites under a test plan need to behave

TestSettings.description: Represents the test settings of the run. Used to create test settings and fetch test settings

areaPath.description: Area path required to create test settings

description.description: Description of the test settings. Used in create test settings.

isPublic.description: Indicates if the tests settings is public or private.Used in create test settings.

machineRoles.description: Xml string of machine roles. Used in create test settings.

children.description: Child test suites of current test suite.

lastUpdatedBy.description: IdentityRef of user who has updated test suite recently.

plan.description: Test plan to which the test suite belongs.

inheritDefaultConfigurations.description: Default configuration was inherited or not.

queryString.description: Test suite query string, for dynamic suites.

TestVariableCreateUpdateParameters.description: Test Variable Create or Update Parameters

VssJsonCollectionWrapper.description: This class is used to serialized collections as a single JSON object on the wire, to avoid serializing JSON arrays directly to the client, which can be a security hole

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '5.0-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.
